p: Mimusops zeyheri is a member of the family Sapotaceae, which are well-known for their wide range of phytochemicals, especially saponins, flavonoids, and polyphenolics [ 37]. Currently, the biological activities of Mimusops zeyheri are relatively scarce, however, studies on members of the genus Mimusops have demonstrated antifungal, gastro-protective, and antinociceptive properties [ 37].
